text: Rick ("Rick the Bass Player") Rosas (September 10, 1949 â€“ November 6, 2014) was an American musician. He has played with Neil Young, Joe Walsh, Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, Jerry Lee Lewis, Johnny Rivers, Ron Wood, Etta James, and the short-lived reunion of the Buffalo Springfield, among others. Rosas was born in Los Angeles, California. Rosas died on November 6, 2014, in Los Angeles, California from lung disease. He was 65. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from lung disease Category:Musicians from Los Angeles
title: Rick Rosas
